title: WhatsApp Web to get reverse image search feature soon to help users identify fake photos - Moneycontrol
summary:
WhatsApp Web to get reverse image search feature soon to help users identify fake photos

Date: December 30, 2024 / Source: Moneycontrol

WhatsApp is introducing a new reverse image search feature to tackle the spread of fake information. This will allow WhatsApp users to authenticate received images via Google and provide a more reliable way to judge the authenticity of shared images.

  • Meta plans to help users identify fake photos on WhatsApp using reverse image search.
  • Users can tap any image in a chat to initiate a reverse image search.
  • The 'Search on the web' option will be available in the three-dot menu for selected images.
  • This feature was previously spotted in the Android beta application.
  • Google's database will help verify the authenticity of shared images.
"The popular messaging platform WhatsApp has often been used for escalating various fake or misleading information across its millions of users."

This new feature aims to combat the spread of misinformation and help users verify the images they receive.
newTitle: WhatsApp Web to Introduce Reverse Image Search Feature Soon

title: Owner Bought Maruti Invicto But Got Innova Hycross Instead - MotorOctane
summary:
Owner Converts Maruti Invicto into Toyota Innova Hycross

Date: October 2023
Source: MotorOctane

The article details the story of a car owner who bought a Maruti Invicto but decided to modify it to resemble a Toyota Innova Hycross. This is notable due to the long waiting periods for the Innova Hycross and the popularity it enjoys.

  • Toyota Innova Hycross has a significant waiting period and is more expensive than Maruti Invicto.
  • The owner transformed the Invicto by modifying the exterior and interior to resemble the Innova Hycross.
  • Exterior modifications include a new grille, bumper, alloy wheels, and rear lights resembling those of the Innova Hycross.
  • Interior changes involved replacing the Suzuki logo with Toyota, adding new steering wheel features, and upgrading the audio system.
  • The transformation was revealed in a video by Indian AutoZone.
“The Indian Motor Vehicle Act states that any modification on the car outside the OEM factory premise is considered illegal.”

This transformation highlights the demand for the Innova Hycross and the lengths owners might go to acquire its aesthetic appeal.
newTitle: Owner Converts Maruti Invicto into Toyota Innova Hycross

title: Ministry issues draft guidelines on establishing EV charging infrastructure under PM E-DRIVE - BusinessLine
summary:
Ministry Issues Draft Guidelines for EV Charging Infrastructure

Date & Source: Updated - December 30, 2024 at 01:34 PM, The Hindu Business Line

Introduction: The Ministry of Heavy Industries (MHI) has issued draft guidelines for setting up electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure under the Prime Minister Electric Drive Revolution in Innovative Vehicle Enhancement (PM E-DRIVE) Scheme.

  1. The scheme aims to set up over 22,000 EV chargers for electric four wheelers and 1,800 chargers for e-buses.
  2. It also includes provisions for charging infrastructure for light EVs like electric two-wheelers and electric three-wheelers.
  3. The government aims to involve various stakeholders, including charge point operators, EV charger manufacturers, and other government bodies.
  4. The scheme offers an 80% subsidy on upstream infrastructure, with an outlay of ₹2,000 crore.

Notable Quote: According to the draft guidelines, central-level Ministries and State governments are encouraged to carry out feasibility studies to identify suitable locations for EV charging stations.

Conclusion: The draft guidelines for EV charging infrastructure aim to expand public charging facilities, involving various stakeholders and offering significant subsidies to promote EV adoption in India.
newTitle: India's Ministry Issues Draft Guidelines for Expanding EV Charging Infrastructure

title: Revolutionary HIV Drug: Lenacapavir Signals New Hope - Devdiscourse
Year-ender | Top space exploration moments and discoveries of 2024 - CNBCTV18
summary:
Top Space Exploration Moments and Discoveries of 2024

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: CNBC TV18

2024 saw significant advancements in space exploration, with notable achievements including Japan's successful moon landing, the first private spacecraft to land on the moon, the retrieval of lunar samples, evidence of ancient microbial life on Mars, the first all-civilian spacewalk, and a mission to Jupiter's icy moon Europa. These milestones push the boundaries of human and robotic space exploration and pave the way for future discoveries.

  • Japan becomes the fifth country to land on the moon.
  • Intuitive Machines' Odysseus spacecraft becomes the first private spacecraft to land on the moon.
  • China's Chang'e 6 mission retrieves lunar samples from the far side of the moon.
  • NASA's Perseverance rover finds evidence of ancient microbial life on Mars.
  • SpaceX conducts the first all-civilian spacewalk.
  • Boeing's Starliner spacecraft has issues with its thrusters, delaying the return of astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore.
  • NASA's Europa Clipper begins its journey to Jupiter's icy moon Europa.
These achievements highlight the progress and innovation happening in space exploration and set the stage for even more fascinating discoveries in the coming years.

While these discoveries and milestones are exciting, they also raise important questions about the future of space exploration, such as how to ensure safe and sustainable exploration, the role of private companies in space, and how to protect our planet's unique environment.
newTitle: Top Space Exploration Moments and Discoveries of 2024

9 Superfoods That Will Help In Your Weight Loss Transformation 2025 - Times Now
summary:
9 Superfoods That Will Help In Your Weight Loss Transformation 2025

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Times Now

This article outlines nine superfoods that can aid in weight loss through their nutritional benefits and ability to help control appetite.

  • Avocados: High in monounsaturated fats and fiber, helping control hunger.
  • Oats: A source of soluble fiber that keeps you full and lowers cholesterol.
  • Chia Seeds: Packed with fiber and protein, promoting a feeling of fullness.
  • Green Tea: Contains catechins that enhance metabolism and aid weight loss.
  • Lentils: An excellent source of plant-based protein and fiber for stabilizing blood sugar.
  • Sweet Potatoes: Low in calories and high in fiber, providing a healthy carbohydrate option.
  • Greek Yogurt: High in protein and supports gut health.
  • Apples: High in water and fiber, naturally sweet, and help reduce calorie intake.
  • Spinach: Low in calories and rich in nutrients, great for anyone trying to lose weight.
“Losing weight isn’t just about cutting calories; it’s about nourishing your body with the right foods that enhance metabolism, curb cravings, and provide essential nutrients.”

In conclusion, incorporating these nine superfoods into your diet may significantly aid in weight loss and overall health.
newTitle: 9 Superfoods That Will Help In Your Weight Loss Transformation 2025

title: Delhi Assembly polls: Arvind Kejriwal announces Rs 18k per month for temple priests, gurdwara granthis if AAP wins - The Indian Express
summary:
Delhi Assembly polls: Arvind Kejriwal announces Rs 18k per month for temple priests, gurdwara granthis if AAP wins

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) national convenor Arvind Kejriwal announced a new welfare scheme targeting pandits and granthis ahead of the upcoming Delhi Assembly polls, promising Rs 18,000 per month to these religious service providers if AAP returns to power.

  • The scheme, named Pujari Granthi Samman Rashi Scheme, aims to win the support of Pandit and Sikh voters, who comprise around 20% of the electorate.
  • Kejriwal highlighted that this is the first initiative of its kind in India, emphasizing respect for those who maintain cultural traditions.
  • The registration for the scheme will start at the Hanuman Temple in Connaught Place, with further rollout planned across all constituencies.
  • Amidst this announcement, protestors demanded unpaid salaries from the government, indicating the broader issues of religious leader remuneration.
  • Polls are scheduled for February 2025.
“These are people who have been serving God for generations... I will not call this amount a salary but it is our respect towards them,” - Arvind Kejriwal

This initiative may reshape voter dynamics as AAP seeks to bolster its support among key religious communities in Delhi.
newTitle: AAP's Promise to Temple Priests and Gurdwara Granthis Ahead of Delhi Elections

title: Watch: Yashasvi Jaiswal Victim Of Huge DRS Controversy, Confronts Umpires At MCG - NDTV Sports
summary:
Watch: Yashasvi Jaiswal Victim Of Huge DRS Controversy, Confronts Umpires At MCG

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: NDTV

In a heated moment during the fourth Test match against Australia, Yashasvi Jaiswal was controversially dismissed following a DRS review that overturned the on-field decision.

  • Jaiswal was in excellent form when he was caught behind off Pat Cummins’ bowling.
  • The umpire initially did not see an edge, but Australia opted for a DRS review.
  • The third umpire ruled there was clear deviation due to contact with Jaiswal's glove.
  • Jaiswal confronted the umpires after his dismissal, showing his displeasure at the decision.
  • Former players and commentators, including Sunil Gavaskar and Ricky Ponting, weighed in on the controversial call.
“There was no spike on the snickometer or any distinct sound that showed that the ball came in contact with Yashasvi's bat.”

This incident has sparked discussions about the effectiveness of DRS and the interpretations made by officials during crucial moments in matches.
newTitle: Yashasvi Jaiswal Faces Controversial DRS Decision During Test Match

title: Snowfall And Sub-Zero Temperatures In Kashmir: Doctors Warn Of Heart Attack And Stroke Risk! - Times Now
summary:
Kashmir's Winter Warnings: Heart Attack and Stroke Risks Spike Amid Snowfall and Cold Temperatures

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times Now

As temperatures in Kashmir plunge below freezing, health experts warn of heightened risks for heart attacks and strokes. The Department of Cardiology at GMC Srinagar has issued an advisory for residents, especially those at higher risk, to take precautions.

  • Heart-related emergencies, such as Myocardial Infarction (MI), are leading causes of death worldwide.
  • 30% of adults in Kashmir suffer from hypertension, significantly increasing risk factors.
  • Cold weather increases blood pressure and stresses the heart due to vasoconstriction.
“Increased consumption of salt... and reliance on processed foods contribute to elevated blood pressure,” - Dr Irfan Ahmed Bhat.

Preventative measures include staying warm, modifying outdoor activities, and regular health monitoring to manage risks effectively.
newTitle: Kashmir's Winter Warnings: Heart Attack and Stroke Risks Spike Amid Snowfall and Cold Temperatures

summary:
7 Latest Space Pictures Captured By NASA Hubble Space

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Times Now

This article features a stunning collection of the latest space pictures captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing various celestial phenomena.

  • The Mice NGC 4676: Colliding spiral galaxies indicating star formation.
  • Westerlund 2: A star cluster located in a stellar nursery.
  • Discovering Protostellar OH 339.88-1.26: A dusty area with bright stars.
  • Young Star HH-47: A complex stellar formation.
  • XZ Tauri: A multiple star system with gas expulsion.
  • Red Giant Star CW Leonis: A stunning carbon star image.
  • Ghostly Star Forming Pillar: The Cone Nebula captured in detail.
“NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has captured an impressive image of the multiple star system known as XZ Tauri alongside neighbor HL Tauri and several young stellar objects.”

This article provides a glimpse into the wonders of space explored by the Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting remarkable cosmic phenomena.
newTitle: 7 Latest Space Pictures Captured By NASA Hubble Space

summary:

Date: 2024

Source: Upstox

In 2024, while some stocks excelled, several market leaders known as 'sleeping giants' faced significant underperformance. This article examines their challenges and potential for recovery.

  • Asian Paints: Experienced a 48.1% decline in net profit in Q2 FY25 due to competition and management changes.
  • Reliance Industries: 5% drop in net profit in Q2 FY25 blamed on weak performance in oil-to-chemical division.
  • Bajaj Finance: Faced 13% profit growth due to rising provisions and credit costs, with plans for future growth focused on new products.
  • Titan: Saw 15% growth in domestic jewellery business but faced challenges in margins due to global price uncertainty.
  • HDFC Life: Reported a 15% YoY rise in net profit but fell short of estimates, with a decline in VNB margins.
  • Dmart: Net profit grew 5.8% YoY but missed estimates due to increased competition and slower growth.
“From the above examples, it is clear that the stock performance is related to the company's financial performance and business outlook.”

In conclusion, various factors like competition and economic conditions significantly impact these 'sleeping giant' stocks, leaving their future performance uncertain.
newTitle: Sleeping Giants: Major Stocks That Underperformed in 2024

Source: News18

Tesla CEO Elon Musk has labeled the H-1B visa system as “broken” and called for “major reform” just days after expressing his willingness to defend the system, which allows skilled foreign workers to work in the US.

  • Musk stated that the current H-1B system needs significant reforms to better attract elite talent.
  • He suggested raising the minimum salary for H-1B visa applicants to make hiring foreign workers more expensive than hiring domestically.
  • The debate surrounding H-1B visas has intensified, particularly with political figures like Trump also voicing support for the program.
Easily fixed by raising the minimum salary significantly and adding a yearly cost for maintaining the H1B, making it materially more expensive to hire from overseas than domestically. I’ve been very clear that the program is broken and needs major reform. — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 29, 2024
